content.raw:
Thank you.

I have no objections with regard to logic or implementation.

Dealing almost exclusively with Proteowizard-generated mzML (and MGF), and using mostly the array data in them, I don't have an exact idea of the use cases this is aimed at, but I believe there are many.
What else did you want to do on this? Do you want it merged now or would you prefer to add something?

I see that since the encoded strings in mzXML contain pairs, the undecoded records in the output are duplicated under 'intensity array' and 'm/z array' keys. When decode() is called on those, we get the full compound array.
Can we maybe make it behave more like mzML? I'm thinking, maybe we could also save the key in the record object and only retrieve the corresponding part of the data on decode().
If you don't think that's a good idea, maybe we should at least avoid the duplication and plug in the reference to the same object under both keys.

Thank you.

I have no objections with regard to logic or implementation.

Dealing almost exclusively with Proteowizard-generated mzML (and MGF), and using mostly the array data in them, I don't have an exact idea of the use cases this is aimed at, but I believe there are many. What else did you want to do on this? Do you want it merged now or would you prefer to add something?

I see that since the encoded strings in mzXML contain pairs, the undecoded records in the output are duplicated under 'intensity array' and 'm/z array' keys. When decode() is called on those, we get the full compound array. Can we maybe make it behave more like mzML? I'm thinking, maybe we could also save the key in the record object and only retrieve the corresponding part of the data on decode(). If you don't think that's a good idea, maybe we should at least avoid the duplication and plug in the reference to the same object under both keys.
